content: Our strong revenue growth, combined with controlled expense management, drove second quarter 2022 adjusted pre-tax, pre-provision income growth of 62% linked quarter annualized. Quarter-over-quarter, average non-interest-bearing demand deposits increased 8% and linked quarter annualized and totaled 44% of average deposits for the second quarter. I would highlight that 84% of our home equity line of credit commitments are in a first lien position residential mortgage loans totaled $12.5 billion as of June 30, 2022, growing by 33% analyzed from March 31. Quarter-over-quarter, non-performing assets decreased by 5%, down to $90 million and the non-performing assets ratio improved by 1 basis point down to 14 basis points of total assets as of June 30. During the second quarter, we booked net recoveries of $7 million or 6 basis points of average loans annualized compared to net charge-offs of 8 basis points of average loans annualized for the first quarter. Importantly, we saw quarter-over-quarter growth in average demand deposits, which made up 44% of our average deposits in the second quarter compared with 43% in the first quarter and 39% in the year ago quarter. We started the rising interest rate cycle from a position of strength with historically high levels of demand deposits for East West Bank, strong liquidity and an average loan-to-deposit ratio of 82% in the second quarter. Second quarter non-interest expense was $197 million, excluding amortization of tax credits and other investments and core deposit intangible amortization, adjusted non-interest expense was $181 million in the second quarter, up $6 million or 4% sequentially from a seasonally lower first quarter.
